dpkg -l  will list all the packages you have installed.  um, depending on what the package name was: dpkg -l | grep jre or mayvbe dpkg -l | grep java

if you installed it from a bin, then it's been strewn all around your system (to where everything is supposed to go), it's exactly like installing from source.  If it's a deb, then you can remove it cleanly with normal package management
